What is Verus Vault, and how does it protect my funds on a VerusID?

Verus Vault is a security feature that allows you to lock your VerusID, protecting your funds from being spent even if your private key is stolen. While your VerusID is locked, you cannot spend funds from that identity, but you can still stake those funds on the Verus network and earn rewards. Additionally, you can still receive funds.

#### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.A locked VerusID can always be revoked and recovered by its revocation and recovery authority identities, which circumvents the lock. At the same time, anyone with only the primary keys, even a multisig of primary keys must first unlock, then wait for the predetermined unlock time before they can spend or access funds. This gives you, or maybe a company that specializes in watching the blockchain to whom you've assigned the revocation ID to revoke and recover whenever an unauthorized unlock occurs. That means that like a bank, setting a 24 hour unlock delay on your locked IDs actually provides the first decentralized solution to the infamous 5 dollar wrench attack.In addition to a new level of blockchain protection and decentralized funds recovery, Verus Vault provides the same security for your IDs and NFTs as well as time locks for other purposes, such as vesting schedules, trusts, and inheritance. With Verus Vault, you can now protect and recover your funds, preserving all your assets and generational blockchain wealth from common forms of crypto loss or theft, no bank required.
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
What are the requirements for enabling Verus Vault capabilities, such as revocation, recovery, and locking?
To enable Verus Vault capabilities, you need to have at least one primary identity and at least one revocation and recovery ID configured.

Can a locked VerusID be revoked and recovered, and how does this work?

Yes, a locked VerusID can be revoked and recovered by its revocation and recovery authority identities, which circumvents the lock. This means that even if someone tries to unlock your VerusID, the revocation and recovery authorities can still revoke and recover the funds.

#### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. How does Verus Vault prevent the "5 dollar wrench attack", and what is the benefit of setting an unlock delay?

Verus Vault prevents the "5 dollar wrench attack" by allowing you to set an unlock delay, such as 24 hours, which means that even if someone tries to unlock your VerusID, they will have to wait for the predetermined unlock time before they can spend or access funds. This gives you or a trusted third-party revocation authority time to detect and respond to unauthorized unlock attempts.

#### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. What are some additional use cases for Verus Vault beyond just protecting funds from theft?

Verus Vault provides security for IDs and NFTs, and can also be used for time locks, vesting schedules, trusts, and inheritance. This means that Verus Vault can be used to protect and recover not just funds, but also other digital assets and decentralized wealth.
